text.text_translated:
Scientists want to know how the ability to talk began.  
They compare human brains with animal brains.  
They study how brains work, not only size.  
They also ask when and why brains changed.  
Old artefacts give signs.  
Artefacts do not show what early people could say.  
We can see changes in the mouth.  
About 100,000 years ago humans could make many sounds.  
Before that scientists can only guess how early people talked.  
They think early people used simple sounds.  
Evolutionary biologists are scientists.  
They study how life changes over time.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Scientists want to know how human speech began.  
They compare human brains with animal brains.  
They look at what the brain can do.  
They also ask when and why the brain changed.  
There are few physical clues from old tools.  
Old tools do not show what speech early people could make.  
We can see changes in the mouth, throat and tongue.  
By about 100,000 years ago humans could make many different sounds.  
Before that scientists can only guess.  
Early humans may have made simple sounds.  
Evolutionary biologists study how animals change over time.
